Sentencas: Carbon assisted solid oxide electrolysis cell (CA-SOEC) owns advantages of fast electrolysis rate, low operating cost and product flexibility.
Titulo: Towards feasible temperature management and thermo-mechanical stability of carbon-assisted solid oxide electrolysis cell

Sentencas: But the endothermic carbon gasification reaction leads to a steep temperature gradient in the anode, thus causing extra thermo-mechanical stress and inhibits long-term operation.
Titulo: Towards feasible temperature management and thermo-mechanical stability of carbon-assisted solid oxide electrolysis cell

Sentencas: Herein, we propose a new CA-SOEC using metal foam in the anode chamber and develop 2D numerical models to evaluate the fluid-dynamic/thermal/chemical/electrochemical/mechanical characteristics of the new cell.
Titulo: Towards feasible temperature management and thermo-mechanical stability of carbon-assisted solid oxide electrolysis cell

Sentencas: It is found that the use of metal foam can significantly enhance the heat transfer process and achieve an even temperature distribution in the CA-SOEC, where the peak temperature difference can be decreased from 57.0 to 21.5 K. As a result, the maximum thermo-mechanical stress is decreased by 69.9 % with the adoption of metal foam.
Titulo: Towards feasible temperature management and thermo-mechanical stability of carbon-assisted solid oxide electrolysis cell

Sentencas: Through further analyses of inlet gas flow rate, inlet gas temperature and the distance between anode chamber and electrode, we find that a small distance and a large flow rate are beneficial for optimizing the temperature distribution.
Titulo: Towards feasible temperature management and thermo-mechanical stability of carbon-assisted solid oxide electrolysis cell

Sentencas: The results of the study provide useful information for the structure optimization of solid oxide cells using carbon fuels.
Titulo: Towards feasible temperature management and thermo-mechanical stability of carbon-assisted solid oxide electrolysis cell
